intro: Diervilla maximowiczii, commonly known as the Korean firethorn, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern Asia. It features dense, spiny foliage and produces clusters of small, orange-red berries in the fall. The plant has narrow, elliptical leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade. Its ornamental value comes from its vibrant berries and winter structure.
